vampire.text: The General arrives with a letter from an unfamiliar count, inviting you to his estate for a night of intellectual discussion. Your advisors warn you against it. A faint, colorful wave washes over your stats, indicating that this choice comes with unknown consequences.
You enter a grand, gothic castle where the Count, a pale and charming man, offers you a glass of dark red wine. He speaks with an unnerving, yet compelling, wisdom.
You stay at home. The General returns, stating the Count was offended by your refusal. Your court is now filled with whispers of his displeasure.
The Count smiles thinly at your refusal. 'A wise decision,' he says, 'but are you truly so strong?' He then offers to test your resolve in a game of strategy, placing a chest of gold on the table.
The Count accepts your apology and surprisingly visits your court. He is impressed by your courtesy and offers a strange gift: an ancient, forgotten text.

You awaken in your bed, but with a strange, hollow feeling. Your commands are ignored. The whispers of the court are no longer about your rule, but about 'His' will. A small, subtle bite mark on your neck is the only physical evidence of your mistake.
The Count's servants harass your kingdom's borders until the people and army revolt against you.
The book contains invaluable knowledge that helps you govern better. The Count leaves, and your kingdom thrives.
The Count disappears silently. You've avoided his game entirely.
